sen.j: 菅沼 定芳（すがぬま さだよし）は、江戸時代前期の譜代大名。
sen.e: Sadayoshi SUGANUMA is a fudai daimyo (feudal lord in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family) from the early Edo period.
Sadayoshi SUGANUMA is a fudai daimyo (feudal lord in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family) in the early Edo period.
Sadayoshi SUGANUMA is a fudai daimyo (feudal lord in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family) in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 伊勢国長島藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: The second lord of Nagashima Domain, Ise Province.
The second lord of Nagashima Domain, Ise Province.
The second lord of Nagashima Domain, Ise Province.

sen.j: 後に近江国膳所藩主を経て、丹波亀山藩の初代藩主となる。
sen.e: Later, after completing the role as the lord of Zeze Domain in Omi Province, he becomes the first lord of the Kameyama Domain of Tanba Province.
Later, after completing the role as the lord of Zeze Domain in Omi Province, he became the first lord of the Kameyama Domain of Tanba Province.
Later, after completing the role as the lord of Zeze Domain in Omi Province, he became the first lord of the Kameyama Domain of Tanba Province.

sen.j: 天正15年（1587年）、菅沼定盈の6男として三河国設楽郡野田城_(三河国)にて生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in 1587 as a sixth son of Sadamitsu SUGANUMA at the Noda Castle, Shirata District (Mikawa Province).
He was born in 1587 as a sixth son of Sadamitsu SUGANUMA at the Noda Castle, Shirata District (Mikawa Province).
He was born in 1587 as a sixth son of Sadamitsu SUGANUMA at the Noda Castle, Shirata District (Mikawa Province).

sen.j: 慶長9年（1604年）から徳川家康に仕え、家康が隠居した後は徳川秀忠に仕えた。
sen.e: From 1604 he served for Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and after Ieyasu's retirement, he served for Hidetada TOKUGAWA.
From 1604 he served for Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and after Ieyasu's retirement, he served for Hidetada TOKUGAWA.
From 1604 he served for Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and after Ieyasu's retirement, he served for Hidetada TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 慶長11年（1606年）、同母兄で長島藩の初代藩主であった菅沼定仍が死去したため、家督を継いで長島藩の第2代藩主となる。
sen.e: Since Sadayori SUGANUMA, the first lord of the Nagashima Domain, who was an elder brother uterine, died in 1606, he succeeds the family estate and becomes the second lord of Nagashima Domain.
Since Sadayori SUGANUMA, the first lord of the Nagashima Domain, who was an elder brother uterine, died in 1606, he succeeded as head of the family and became the second lord of Nagashima Domain.
sen.cmt: 「家督を継ぐ」の訳を変更しました。時制を変更しました。
sen.e: Since Sadayori SUGANUMA, the first lord of the Nagashima Domain, who was an elder brother uterine, died in 1606, he succeeded as head of the family and became the second lord of Nagashima Domain.

sen.j: 慶長19年（1614年）からの大坂の陣においても徳川方として参戦し、武功を挙げた。
sen.e: In the Osaka no Jin (the Siege of Osaka) from 1614, he participated as the Tokugawa side, and gave a distinguished war service.
In the Osaka no Jin (the Siege of Osaka) from 1614, he participated as the Tokugawa side, and gave a distinguished war service.
In the Osaka no Jin (the Siege of Osaka) from 1614, he participated as the Tokugawa side, and gave a distinguished war service.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)7年（1621年）、近江膳所藩に3万1000石で加増移封される。
sen.e: In 1621, he changes the territory with additional properties of 31,000 koku to Omi Zeze Domain.
In 1621, he changed the territory with additional properties of 31,000 koku to Omi Zeze Domain.
In 1621, he changed the territory with additional properties of 31,000 koku to Omi Zeze Domain.

sen.j: 寛永11年（1634年）、1万石加増の4万1000石で丹波亀山藩へ移封される。
sen.e: 1634, he changes the territory with additional properties of 10,000 koku, 41,000 koku total, to the Kameyama Domain of Tanba Province.
In 1634, he changed the territory with additional properties of 10,000 koku, 41,000 koku total, to the Kameyama Domain of Tanba Province.
In 1634, he changed the territory with additional properties of 10,000 koku, 41,000 koku total, to the Kameyama Domain of Tanba Province.
He dies in 1643, January 17.
He died on February 25, 1643.
He died on February 25, 1643.
Age of death, 57.
Died at 57.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせて変更しました。
sen.e: Died at 57.

sen.j: 正室との間には先立たれた娘2人のみで、家督は庶出の長男・菅沼定昭が継いだ。
sen.e: Between his lawful wife, there were only 2 daughters who died before him, so the eldest son, Sadaakira SUGANUMA succeeded the family estate.
Between his lawful wife, there were only two daughters who died before him, so the eldest son, Sadaakira SUGANUMA succeeded as head of the family.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。「家督を継ぐ」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Between his lawful wife, there were only two daughters who died before him, so the eldest son, Sadaakira SUGANUMA succeeded as head of the family.
